content.text:
[@daan](@MRiJ+CvDnD9ZjqunY1oy6tsk0IdbMDC4Q3tTC8riS3s=.ed25519) 

At this point I'd recommend the solution they mentioned at the bottom:

> I’m thinking of re-downloading everything so I’d move ~/.ssb out of the way (move, not delete!) and then just copy (not move! :P ) the files ~/.ssb/[config, gossip.json, and secret] to a new ~/.ssb, and restart.

1. Turn off all SSB clients.
2. `mv ~/.ssb ~/.ssb.bak`
3. `mkdir -p ~/.ssb/`
4. `cp ~/.ssb.bak/secret ~/.ssb/` 
5. `cp ~/.ssb.bak/gossip.json ~/.ssb/
6. Start an SSB server.

As an aside, I think flumedb should probably be fixed so that it throws an error rather than retrying until the stack blows up.
